0.review:
No massives on earth rock like EDC, and there's no city better than LA as its host.

My first EDC experience was in 2006; my only wish is to have had an earlier start.  I do miss those lesser ones held in the streets of downtown LA years back - there's something special about partying under darkened skies amongst those majestic skyscrapers.  LA Coliseum and fairground has been EDC's home for the past half decade, and the property certainly does the event justice.

The line up is always sick, and the overall event production (stages, sound, lighting, fireworks, art/show pieces, vendors, carnival rides, acts) is over the top and get progressively insane as years progress.

180,000 visitors (in the 2010 EDC) can't be wrong!

I love you, Insomiac.

1.review: Five stars for the super efficient will call and entry lines!!  Nothing beats walking right into an event that you are super stoked about!  I went in 2009 on the Saturday and it was a bit too crowded for my liking, but could have been worse (being outside really cuts down on the claustrophobia and annoying pushy people).  This past year I went on the Friday, and it was perfect. I loved partying as the sun was going down and having room to roam around.  The lights and art installations are top-notch, and the music is always gonna be great.

2.review:
EDC has grown a whole lot. This use to be my annual music fest, who am I kidding thee best rave everrrrrr and still going strong! I loved it when it was here in LA! I wish they would come back here but hey its a great excuse for a road trip. I went to EDC LA until the last year they had it here. This is how a crowd get down and real. The music is always great and when the beat drops the crowd goes wilding. 
   I love making costumes for each day. It's really my favorite part besides the music. We get to see so much creativity come out of people. Always good vibes and awesome people.
  The last year in LA was crazy though, music was turned off in the main room for a long time, and vendors refused to sell anything until the music was back on. People were jumping from the seating area into the arena, on vendor tents. I guess they had a good reason not to hold it here anymore lol.
   Although it's no longer in LA. EDC is still thee most awesome rave and you can experience it in Las Vegas the city that never sleeps, just like ravers! LOL 
PLUR! (^_^)

3.review: It's crazy how EDC has grown since my first time attending in 2010. I can honestly say its such an amazing experience reason why Ive gone every year. Though everyone wishes it would come back to LA but having it in Vegas just gives it more of an adventure. See you guys there this year!

4.review:
I like how under the business info it says "good for kids: no." That's right kiddies, this is not where you should be. However, if you are an adult, then EDC is super... sweet.

It really feels like being at the OC Fair, except like a thousand times better. And there's loud music. 

2008 was the first year Insomniac threw it here and man that was legit. Huge venue, lots of space to move around.

2009 was the best year here. Still spacious, great music, vibe was still awesome. EDC 2009 definitely ranks among the top 5 EDM events I've been to.

2010 was a little ridiculous. WAY TOO MANY PEOPLE. WAY TOO MANY SHENANIGANS GOING ON. and was it just me, or did it take Forever to go anywhere. 

See ya'll in vegas!

5.review:
2009.

Rode up here with my boyfriend & two of his guy friends. Met up with some more of his friends when we got there. One guy was like "what?! you just met him & you came down here with him?!" Haha.. cause at the time, my boyfriend & i just know each other for like a couple of months; practically like strangers.  We went both days, but the first day, we got there it was like 10pm-ish? It was fun and we got to ride the bumper cars & just dance. Then the next day, we got there at like afternoon time about 6pm-ish or even earlier. It was bright & sunny. Not much excitement yet. Then as it progressed later, started to dance. By the time it was dark, it was cold. Brrr... It's always fun to see people get all dressed up in their raver gear/costumes. Cute. The one thing I wish that I/we could have done was ride more rides, but the only ride that we got to ride on was the bumper cars. :(

We got to see ATB, Kaskade, David Guetta, and I don't remember who else.

6.review: What can i say about EDC.... This is definitely something to experience. Its out of this world AMAZING. one of the things i love most about Raves is the fact that you can act anyway, dress anyway be a complete weirdo and instead of getting weird looks people join along! Its amazing to act truly urself and be accepted. Theres no judgement. Insomniac puts on the best events possible and they really go above and beyond. This shall be my second year in vegas and 3rd year overall . And I CANNOT WAIT !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The music, the people, the rides, THE MUSIC!!!! 7.review:
Went for the first time in 2010. Absolutely AMAZING! 
One of the greatest sensory experiences of my life. Music, sights and sound. An absolute must if you are even a casual fan of the electronic dance music scene. Easily one of the most memorable weekends of my life.

I don't think I've ever seen a better line up of electronic music artists in the United States or the world for that matter!
Armin Van Buuren, Deadmau5, Wolfgang Gartner, Kaskade, MSTRKRFT, BoysNoize, Above and Beyond, Swedish House Mafia, Laidback Luke, Chuckie...and on and on. 

Somethings I would fix though: Free water is a must for avoiding dehydration, I've been to other massives that were a fraction of the size, and there definitely were some times where I felt overwhelmed by the huge number of people there. So careful, it is VERY easy to lose track of the people you came with which can ruin your experience there.

8.review:
EDC 2009 was my first rave ever. I was first shocked by all the people in neon colored clothing (or lack thereof), kandi bracelets, and crazy shuffling.

I love electronica, but I had no idea this was the kind of culture the music is associated with. I almost wanted to leave because my prude ass was shocked and scared.

However, just by looking at everyone, art installations and the music all blended together, I fell in love with EDC. The energy was crazy (I didn't even roll both times I went), and it's seriously just one crazy party. Friendly people (of course), amazing light shows, awesome music, cool rides... It was really a great way to kickoff the summer.

What I loved about EDC was the venue. It's huge! You have the coliseum and the areas surrounding it. It was crowded as hell, but it's all part of the fun. EDC always has a great line up, and the performances are just outstanding.

Things I didn't like about EDC? Bathrooms; they get disgusting by the time it gets dark. Also parking is terrible ($25 is the cheapest I've seen) and traffic gets so crazy around the venue. Tip: make sure you get a legit parking spot, i.e. USC parking, unlike those shady places super close to the venue... they cost around $60 and I wouldn't consider it safe... I'm sure your car would be highly likely to get jacked.

I had so much fun EDC 2009 that I went to Monster Massive, which was not as good primarily because of the venue (Just the sports arena, not the coliseum). I went to EDC 2010 and it was better than 2009. The best lineup!!! One thing I did was go on the very top of the coliseum and I saw the view from up there, which included the Downtown LA skyline. It was beautiful.

Overall I highly recommend EDC. It's a great way to start off the summer and it's an awesome experience. Have fun and be safe!

9.review:
EDC 2008...someone stole my cell phone out of my pocket but i still had a ridiculously good time...the music...the lights...the insanely good vibes...everything was beautiful...twas a blur.

EDC 2010...got VIP tickets (best decision ever)...the cheeseburger we ate while waiting for the epicness to begin...lil jon making an appearance, and yelling over all the music (ok that was weird)...the beats and melodies carrying us away while the evening sunset enveloped the entire arena with a vibrant orange-yellow illumination...the utter epicness and oneness with the music...the happiness that uplifted every moment...the INSANE rides...armin van buuren ENHANCING the insane rides...OMG. i had the time of my life.

starting this year the electric daisy carnival may never be the same again, but i thank insomniac for all the lovely vibes, the energy, the potent music, the dazzling lights.

11.review:
Electric Daisy Carnival...that name means a lot if you are a raver.  Heck if you were a raver in the last decade you should know that name.  

I have seen the Electric Daisy Carnival grow over the years from a smaller massive that had like 30,000 attending (at the time that was huge) to last year where they had 180,000 attending over 2 days.  If I know my facts that is the largest electronic music festival in North America.  

I remember back when EDC used to be at the Orange Show in San Bernardino.  I actually like parties at the Orange Show better than the Los Angeles Coliseum but there is technically more room for people at the Coliseum so I can understand the move.  I really think that with the amount of people who attended in 2010 that they might consider moving it to another newer venue that can handle that amount of people.  

While EDC has awesome music and great world class DJ's, what really impresses me is the production of the whole night.  It really seems like they think of every last detail when designing stages, lighting, decor and the little details.  

In fact one of my favorite raver memories was from EDC in San Bernardino when they had a helicopter fly over the party and drop bags full of actual daisies onto the crowd.  It was literally raining daisies on the Electric Daisy Carnival. 

I know there was some drama at this years event and I know the rave scene in general is going through a state of flux right now but hopefully the Electric Daisy Carnival will be something we can look forward to for years to come.  

:0)

12.review:
AWE-SOME.....sort of? ahha. 

It was my first year at EDC but definitely not my first rave. I have to say I would've preferred they kept it at opening around 4pm or so and ending at 4am instead of this 2pm to 2am nonsense. My friends and I got there around 4 or 5pm-ish? The security guards are unnecessarily mean, I mean yeah I understand why they break up the entrance into female & male lines but if you're going to break up our group you can't just yell at people for waiting for their friends. Seriously? That's dumb. And WHAT THE HECCKK is going on with the bathrooms. I KNOW you guys make MORE THAN ENOUGH money from these raves to at least have a constant supply of TOILET paper. I GOTTA BRING MY OWN TOILET PAPER IN FROM HOME. LOL (it ALWAYS happens) . And who are the dummbb people clogging up the sinks with toilet paper?! seriously?! ya'll need to learn some good hygiene and stop being lazy. the trash can is right there. If I can be drunk and make it to the bathroom AND the toilet then no one is too drunk to toss a paper towel into the trash.

Anyways enough about bathrooms! It was SO SO SO stupid that they close off the field access at a certain point. They should do it like how clubs do it, if people leave they let in an x amount of people in. You know? So people didn't feel like if they were trapped in and had to PEE ON THE FLOOR. YES, you nasties, I heard about the field access being a "pee palace"  by the end of the night. Nor would they have the problem of people climbing the fences to jump into the field and getting hurt and breaking the fences. People don't pay that absurd amount of forever increasing ticket prices just to be locked out of the field. 

I love these things, but theres some nasty ass people out there, so just watch out. -___- icckk. I had a lot fun, but unless Insomniac ups their game I'm not sure if I'll be back to EDC again. They need to keep that 18+ thang going on forever. It will probably clear up the area a lot more and there will be a lot more room to move and less havoc. Yes, I'm sure they make tons of money off you kids but you're are soooo doomed if you're raving at 16.. LOL

15.review:
EDC2010 was my first large scale concert/festival and converted me into a fan of trance music. 

I really love the atmosphere, everyone was there to just have a good time and listen to good beats. It really is the best outdoor club experience one can have. Friday is suppose to less crowded than Saturday but the main field was closed pretty early on (before darkness) but there was still plenty of seating in the coliseum to enjoy the music. 

The usual quibbles have more to do with logistic stuff: expensive food/drinks, zero cell phone reception at all, pricey lockers (going with a group? coordinate & split the locker price). Don't forget to wear comfy shoes because there is a bit of walking between the fields and you want to be able to get your dance on. 

There's always something interesting to look at, occasionally a friendly unexpected hug from a stranger and eargasms to last throughout the night.

16.review:
EDC.. Electric Daisy Carnival.. the best and most exhilarating rave of MY time??? in my opinion, it's one of my favorite raves. My favorite DJs and the theme of the flowers (I have an obsession with flowers..), the location (it WAS held at the LA Colosseum for many years until recently, ahem) being outdoors in a wide and open area.. you have to actually attend to know the feeling but I've been to EDC twice (2009 & 2010) and both times had to be the best times of my life.

There's just something about EDC that makes it stand out from the rest. Yes, it's outdoors and consists of some of the best DJs and maybe it's the weather but I'm seriously not sure how to explain this 5 star feeling in words but take my advice, go to EDC and you be the judge.

Important tip: Don't overdose on drugs and ruin it for the rest of us.

Sincerely, a girl who's never popped and has attended many raves strictly because I love the music. After all, isn't that what these raves are about? The music?

17.review:

(by big kids I mean 18+ only please). Never failed to have fun here, there is always has a huge line-up of great DJs, 2 days of non-stop fun, day to night!

you just know you're having a great time when you never want the night to end, and when the last DJ closes everyone chants "ONE MORE SONG" :)

18.review: Saw a girl convulsing and foaming at the mouth on the floor before even entering the gates.. Not good for kids indeed.

19.review:
EDC is straight stupid fun. haha music lovers unite and for a newer generation EDC is the massive for kids in the LA area. EDC use to take place in San Bernardino and got moved to the LA Coliseum, it's like what the heck!? 

For one the music and production is always insanely good but haaaa parking!!! HORRIBLE, let me rant before I get to all the good stuff. Don't get me wrong the event itself is awesome but man did anyone think that putting this in the middle of the city would benefit anyone? Many potential hazards, traffic, and parking issues, I understand why they did it, especially seeing how much lots were charging for parking! Anyway if you had a hard time you probably had to walk quite a while to get to the actual event.

Now to the good stuff, the music was awesome as always. There were about 6 stages throughout the coliseum. The main stage was inside the coliseum and if you walked up and looked down into it, there were so many people in there that it looked like a bunch of ants, INSANELY awesome and crazy.
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8wSaXktuHKI
 Also there were a number of carnival rides inside the coliseum and throughout the grounds. 

At all massives and outdoor festivals be prepared to be raped by the prices of food, alcohol, and mainly water. By the end of the night you'll see people laying out and see the casualties everywhere from you know what are extreme exhaustion hahaha. People that don't like super huge crowds I don't advise it or you might have a anxiety attack or something. Great place to dance and enjoy a super platform of DJs.

20.review:
A star for every year I've been to EDC Los Angeles. This festival was my first rave ever, after my friend kidnapped me to go here. It is soo crazy seeing this event reach the level that it has now out in Las Vegas, where it is now. I went the last years that it was only 1 day..and then 2 days..then when I thought it couldn't get any better, Insomniac made it 3 days long in Vegas! 
Other than the last year that EDC was in LA, EDC LA was an epic event. The last year didn't really impress me, because Deadmau5, who I was really looking forward to see, played the worst show ever! He literally came out a total of 3 times during his set and it was obvious he was playing a pre-recorded set. Other than being disappointed during his set, every other aspect (including other DJs) of the EDCs I have attended were phenomenal. EDC LA left a life-long impression on me and has hooked me as a life loyal attendee.

21.review: I'm so sad this isn't being held in LA anymore. Real shame. Last year, EDC was probably the best 2 days of my life. The daytime was a little slow, but when it became night... man, the production put forward for this event was just amazing. The artists put up amazing sets, and the light production was awesome. Something about the art, giant following, and amazing energy that happens at EDC... just makes it so incredible. I wish so so badly that I could go to EDC vegas. :(

23.review:
Super fun, with a few cons:

-parking is A BITCH. this is what you'll see: http://media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/huqZJnK_0HdA2N2TKkZA1w/l. We ended up parking for free next to USC, but it took a while.
-even worse, traffic is A BITCH. it takes a hour to get from the highway ramps to EDC, and vice versa.
-they closed the main field.
-walking from field to field takes forever.

Otherwise, it was great. So much to do...maybe too much--you can't do it all! We went on a ferris wheel as I wished but it took about an hour to get there. There were also other rides next to a small field. I actually had the best time at the smaller fields. We went to Kinetic (with Kaskade and Deadmau5) and it was hard to dance there because people would be moving across the stands all the time. Also, the sound quality wasn't all that from where we were. 

Drinks were okay priced ($8/small cocktail) and the food was unremarkable, in the typical carnival way.  There were actually a lot of restrooms! Nice.

EDC is definitely a stimulus overload experience though, even without drugs (I don't do drugs!) Tons of awesome lights, visual effects, disco ball trees, etc. Amazing music. Costumed, young people (the girls are nearly naked actually...sucks if you have a bf with wandering eyes, haha). 

I gotta say though, I'm kind of glad I came too late to get into the main field after watching the videos of it. Though I noticed how NO Asians were hopping the fences...and yes, there were Asians at EDC. My experience at EDC was very peaceful. People were quite pleasant, minus some guys who cut in the ferris wheel line. I also really loved seeing all the cute furry backpacks people were wearing.

All-in-all, super fun, though I should not have worn heels! I required much piggy-backing to the car.

24.review:
edc is always a blur for me... and that's the way i like it... :D

25.review:
Best & hugest rave ever !!! 
I went the first time in 2010, and am definitely going this year. 
I wish that I was old enough to get the VIP tickets, but I had a great time nonetheless. 
I also wish that they provided free water, because the water is pretty ridiculous around $5 a bottle, especially when the producers KNOW that people need water, at least this year they will be selling $10 refillable aluminum water bottles.  I'd suggest anyone going to purchase one online beforehand .
important +++ First timers be prepared for no - cell - phone reception ( due to the insane amounts of people using their cells at once ) , so always have a time & place to meet after it ends so you don't get lost. 
Great lineups & great decorations & great people. 
I love how everyone dresses super crazy like they DGAF, TONS of naked girls there basically 99% naked. I am so glad that this year they will be enforcing an 18 + up policy, because 2010 had way too many underage kids ( doing things that they should not be doing )....

30.review:
I would definitely say this is the biggest rave in California.  I mean it's HUGE!  It takes 2 days!  So many neon colors and kandies to trade!

2010 was my first EDC.  I think I went on a Friday.  I've heard good things about this rave and they were all true.  Yeah it's super hippie with all the flower power things but it's all about love man!

Unlike the other raves this has performers and dancers that go around giving really good shows and great kodak moments.  Also they actually have to use the Coliseum which is a really good choice on their part since it was super packed and they had to open the whole ground.

So much more entertainment then the others.  They have those awesome cube lights that everyone just seems mesmerized in, a rat hole with 3D glasses, and some fire sculpture things.  They also have carnival rides which is so much fun.

I think next time I'll get a VIP pass since they get to go down to the main floor and they have 2 of the best carnival rides down there!

FYI: Why the hell would you take your kid here?  I mean I know it's a carnival and all but look around you! BAD!  This is why raves were almost shut down. 

There's such much things about this rave that I can go on and on about but you should really experience it yourself.  It's truly an amazing experience in your young life and I'm going to miss if when I get wrinkles. ;)

31.review:
One of the best nights of my life. Hands down.

It was just amazing... The amount of people that gathered all for the same thing, The music pumping through your body everywhere you walked, The day turned to night, and the fireworks that illuminated the sky as you danced without a care to the blissful beats of Deadmau5 and others. It was a night that I will never forget.

Yes, it was not perfect, but what event of that size ever has been. I mean you don't show up to the largest rave in america and not expect there to be a shit load of people there. The numbers have been increasing every year, so why would this one be any different? If not, it would only be even bigger, since the biggest rising dance artist of the year, and the biggest name in trance are headlining...

And as for all that crap about fence jumping and people getting hurt, and that one girl even died!.. OK, my condolences go out to that girls family, having a death in the family is hard, i cant even imagine it being your child.... BUT you cannot blame her taking drugs on an event, any more than video-games for kids shooting other kids. Its their own ignorance and apathy. As for all those people who got hurt. More than likely their own fault. Some 250 out of 180,000 people messed up, and now theres this huge dim view on raves. Cause there have been less riots and fights due to hockey, or football, or basketball, etc. right? (note: sarcasm above)

My final word/opinion: Definitely the best massive I've ever been to. Just as good, if not better than last year! Can't wait for next year!

49.address: 4372 West Point Loma Blvd, Ste A
49.review:
Do NOT book Adam Brooks (Brooks Photography) or any of the companies he may be advertising as for photography!!! (The Photography Company)

I'm sad to say my husband and I have also been victims of Adam Brooks and his photography company.  Our wedding was June 14,2014. He was paid in full and failed to deliver our pictures, a very expensive photo album and a canvas photo we had ordered which was supposed to be present at our wedding, however they failed to get it in on time. It became impossible to get a hold of Adam after our wedding to retrieve our items. It spiraled from leaving voicemails, to the phone not working, to a very discomforting message on their website indicating "restructuring". Apparently not too long ago Adam was advertising under the business name "The Photography Company" thefotoco.com . I was very enraged to visit this link and see my wedding photo displayed as his sample work. My husband and I clearly stated in our contract that no wedding pictures were to be used by him as sample work, unless pre approved by us. 

News10 just reported on how Adam has scammed dozens of newlyweds (http://www.10news.com/news/dozens-of-newlyweds-say-they-were-scammed-by-local-wedding-photographer-02022015) . 

We will be joining the growing number of couples who will be seeking legal action.

58.address: 4372 West Point Loma Blvd, Ste A
58.review:
Update: After considering my day of experience, and the number/type of photos I would have like that I didn't get, I would not recommend this business unless you want the barest of bare bones. I guess you get what you pay for.



Fun and professional. Adam loves what he does and he's great at it. BEST prices in San Diego (there is no way you will get this kind of quality photography for less). I had to re-plan our wedding in only a months time and was delighted to meet Adam at a bridal bazar. His prices were 1/5 what I had seen through many other local photographers, and I liked the work of his that I saw as well as his personality. I was relieved that we could have everything I needed and wanted within our budget (we didn't think we could afford having more than one photographer at our event). He even offered to do a 45 minute test shoot for free so we could be sure we liked his style and could communicate together to get what we wanted! Our pics were ready in about a month, and we got EVERY SINGLE ONE on CD. It was included in our package! By not overcharging for every little thing (I worked with a photographer who charged $100+ PER FILE for digital images!) we can now order bunches of pictures for ourselves and our loved ones! Super happy with our photos and our experience :)

59.address: 4372 West Point Loma Blvd, Ste A
59.review:
Unfortunately I must add my name to the list of reviewers who have had a bad experience with Adam Brooks.  This business is currently defunct (their website has more information) due to Adam stepping down and is likely the reason this business is erroneously listed as being in Las Vegas which it is not (it's in San Diego).  Adam Brooks has gone MIA and I, like many others listed here, have no photos to show for my money and have not heard from him since the shoot despite multiple attempts to contact. So we will see what comes of this.  The business address that is listed at one site I found with a coupon is:  

4372 W. Pt. Loma Blvd #B
San Diego, CA 92107

brooksphotoservice@gmail.com

My heart goes out to others here who have had their wedding photos go missing as a result of this flaky business.

63.address: 4372 West Point Loma Blvd, Ste A
63.review:
One word comes to mind when I think of Adam Brooks... "Unprofessional!" 

I had the exact same experience as "Lakedra m". We hired him to shoot our wedding last fall (October 2013). He seemed like a really nice guy when I met him but he turned out to be such a horrendous person to deal with after the wedding. He did not follow through with his timeline on when he would upload pictures to his website or provide prints (if you deny this, Adam, I will gladly upload the original timeline & emails). I had to send a few nasty emails to get a response from him (I gave him a week or 2 to respond), actually his assistant responded (different one every time), and he never once apologized for his lack of professionalism. After a few months, he finally uploaded all the pictures (unedited..wt#!@ was he doing for so long) to his website. It took a few more months to receive my prints, photo book, and video (picture collage), which I received separately and he had to replace the 8x10 pictures because he didn't review the originals before sending them so I had to tell him that my husband's head was cut off on one of the pictures.  

Aside from all the frustration, overall I was not completely satisfied with his work. He lacks creativity and professionalism. We took pictures at Balboa Park and I have about 3 pictures total that I like (family & friends took better poses/pictures). Adam and his assistant took the same pictures but different sides, personally I don't care for the side view I prefer the front view. Most of the ceremony and reception pictures were taken by Derek (awesome assistant), Adam didn't do anything and the few pictures he took were mediocre. The prints were nice quality but the photobook is garbage (Costco has better quality). I came out orange on all the pictures in the photo book and the video (picture collage) was standard (not impressed...can't believe I had to wait 7 months for that). 

Overall ladies, hire a professional and do your research on the photographer! I don't have pictures of all my guest :( I told Adam I wanted table shoots of guest and family/friends group portraits taken during reception and he didn't take them! (Adam, it's on the check off list that we reviewed before the wedding..i'll gladly upload it) It's your wedding so don't sell yourself short. You may contact me if you'd like to see his poor quality work......Adam, if you have the audacity to deny any of this, I kept every email, text message, document provided, and receipts to prove it!

64.review:
I had the pleasure of attending one of her make up classes yesterday. I truly enjoyed and benefited from her class tremendously.  She went over skin care routines.  Helped us identify our face shape and eyes to help enhance our features according to face type. Taught us the basic need to know for that perfect brow and those contouring techniques to define your face type.
She also performed a demo where she went into detail from brows, eyeshadow, foundation, blush and contouring! You name it she pretty much cover it. 
Despite being a pretty big class she was never too busy to answer any one on one questions or assist you.  She also had a wonderful group of friends who were helping her.. The class was just about 4 hrs long and she was gracious enough to provide refreshments and snacks. .Although now I regret skipping on those chocolate cover strawberries, lol.
Overall, I loved it and was well worth my 200 mile round trip in the pouring rain. So if your contemplating enhancing your skills or perhaps getting to know the basics I encourage you to give her a try.. she was truly amazing!

65.address: 4372 West Point Loma Blvd, Ste A
65.review:
I think most, if not all the people who have recently filed reviews here belong in the same boat with me and my wife, basically otherwise happily married couples who thought they got a great deal on wedding photography and thought were dealing with a reputable company and until now, genuinely nice guys (Adam and other photographers). My wedding was September 2014 and as you may have guessed, I have not received any of my wedding photos yet, just one email stating the condition of the company and the progress of photos... I checked the update website again yesterday and this is when I learnt about the chapter 7 bankruptcy filing. I did call the Bankruptcy court responsible for San Diego and while no current bankruptcy filing exist for Brooks photography, there was a bankruptcy filing back in 1993... 

My original consultation and contact was with Rick Lammert, who insisted that because my wife and I got a deal that was only meant for San Diego clients, that we needed to pay the full cost upfront... Note to self, in the future whenever a professional service is due in the future tense, do not pay everything upfront!!! Adam did come and do our engagement photo shoot because Rick "lives close to the California/Mexico border and would have to drive too far to get to Orange County". Working with Adam was great, and we did get our engagement photos and prints which made us think further we made the right choice in photographer.

Adam, along with two more photographers and a videographer did come to our wedding and based on all accounts from friends and family, they did a wonderful job and this is what got me... If Adam was really running a scam, why didn't he/Rick just take our money at the beginning and stopped responding to emails and communications right away, but actually came out to do an engagement shoot, and wedding? Both of which were extremely hot days and we were all sweating our butts off!

After not hearing anything from them for 2 months, I was finally able to get a hold of Rick through a cell phone of his, and learnt that he has since left the company and is working for George Street Photos and Video (big company). I am contemplating sending him a nasty text or call him and threaten to include him in a lawsuit, or better yet, tell his current employer about my experience to see what he would say. As far as I know, Rick is still able to contact Adam Brooks...

Anyway, if any and all couples who would like to come together for a class action (since I think combined, our claim would be too large for small claims court) lawsuit against Adam Brooks and possibly his "accomplice" Rick Lammert, please contact me at junk1297@gmail.com. I am at a lost currently about what to do, and wondering if bringing any lawsuits would get me and my wife anything, but anything is worth a try...

75.review:
Attending this makeup class has got to be one of the best decisions I've ever made!  I have very little experience putting on anything more than mascara and lip gloss, and now I feel equipped to do an even better job than any cosmetics counter could (on myself, of course).  
The instructor presented various information on skin care, face shape, eye shape, application sequence, contouring, and brand/product tips.  She provided pen and paper to take notes, a full-color packet on everything covered, and snacks and drinks.  The best thing about it all is her ability to build an instant rapport with each of her students.  We were a diverse group with different cosmetic needs, but she effortlessly made us feel welcome and comfortable. She guided each of us to help achieve the look we desired.  You can tell that she really went out of her way to make it "all about the client."  She was very genuine in wanting to help us, and she did all she could to make it fun for us  - fun snacks, festive decor, and even a raffle with awesome prizes.
I loved it that she wasn't trying to sell us anything, and she wasn't "pushing" any specific product or brand.  She made it clear that we could achieve a glamorous look without having to buy expensive materials.  She even gave different suggestions of high end products along with their less expensive equivalents.
After the lesson and demonstration - she allowed the class to sit and do their own make up.  I don't know many people who would open up their make up collection to a group of girls eager to dig in to and "experiment." Doing that really gave me a chance to see what brushes, make up, primers, etc. that I really need to build my own makeup collection.  
The class was incredibly informative and a lot of fun.  It was refreshing to feel like a little girl again with a sea of makeup and a mirror in front of me and no time limit.  As we did this, she came to each one of us to help apply or guide us in choosing the right color, product, etc.
All in all, I walked away with a list of products for my wish list, detailed step-by-step application instructions, and fun-filled day with friends!

99.review:
Sadly, I really did not want to write a negative review. I have had only two experiences with Ms. Tiffany. I came to her for the first time looking for an inexpensive quality braider in my local area that I could rely on. I thought I had found that until my latest experience with her. 

My first appointment however worked out OK. I researched her work, contacted her, met with her, made an appointment, paid my setting fee, showed up for my appointment, she did her thing and I was out the door in 5 hrs. Although there were distractions and small set backs throughout the appointment, it was not the worst I've dealt with and to be honest stylist are people too so no big deal. She did her best to remain professional despite being obviously annoyed at times. 

 I recently made an appointment online, wherein I text & fb messaged her the day after to confirm. Instead she did not respond to my communications, but sent me an invoice for my setting fee. I was a little put off by the lack of response, but forwarded a bill instead...but oh well, I had my answer one way or another.  I paid my PayPal invoice and purchased my hair.

Ms. Tiffany did contact me during the week  before my weekend appointment to ask if I could come in on a Wed. morning. I explained I make weekend appointments because I work during the week. At the same time I did ask to clarify if she would still be able to keep my appointment, she quickly responded that she would.  Again this made me wonder, but moving onto my Saturday Nov. 1st 9am appointment was my expectation. 

Saturday morning I make my way to Ms. Tiffany's, park and call her so she can let me in and we can get started. It went straight to voicemail. I text. No response. I call again, straight to voicemail. Come to find out she had sent me a fb message at 8:57am, before our 9:00am appointment letting me know that she was not going to be available. I don't know about anyone else but if Ms. Tiffany herself were in my place I don't think that even she would want to be cancelled on 2mins prior to her appointment, and then be blown off/straight ignored while waiting outside of the business by the business owner themselves! 

But it gets better, I leave disappointed but not as mad as maybe I should have been. I did fb message her back in response that I was not interested in her offer to see my "later" (no time/date given by the way) and would like my setting fee refunded to me immediately thru PayPay because services were not rendered and the appointment that this fee holds was CANCELLED BY HER THE BUSINESS OWNER. 

I have since reached out  to her several times, thru many forms of communication, and although she has seldom responded  Ms. Tiffany has had my setting fee 13 days and counting.  
 

The quality of my braids I was happy with overall, she is a skilled stylist. By all means please check out the proof in her pictures. But after my first impression of her during my first appointment and her latest lack of accountability as a business owner that made a mistake, but is not taking responsibility for it, I am very disappointed. I will admit she did apologize at the very least. However, Ms. Tiffany's refusal to do the right thing and refund the setting fee for an appointment that was un-set/cancelled by her is not professional. I have been basically ignored and feel robbed. Where is the integrity? I have considering my experience been courteous and patient.  Any customer service based business that is responsible for a poor customer service experience goes out of their way to take responsibility for the instance, and accommodate the patron by refunding them at the very least; if not providing them a credit toward services.

She is a very lovely hard working woman, but I am very sadden to experience her reluctance to  return to me the funds that are rightfully mine, especially in light of the fact that SHE CANCELLED ON ME.

I really didn't want to write this AND had hoped that, (giving her the benefit of the doubt), by the week after my appointment cancellation this should be resolved but its NOT.  I STILL don't have my funds and she has not reached out to me at all since I last contacted her.

100.review:

101.address: 4372 West Point Loma Blvd, Ste A
101.review:
I've noticed a pattern with these scam artists through reading all of these complaints against them. It seems as though they do just enough to have you believe they are a legitimate photography company, then they steal your money. If you think about it, going out to an engagement shoot for a few hours and a wedding (free food and drinks) to shoot pictures isn't that hard to do considering the fact that they'd make (steal) anywhere between $1500 to $3500. All that money for a few hours of walking around snapping pictures. 

I'm in the same boat as everyone else here. We booked this guy for our 4/18/15 wedding. And like most of you, we paid up front; although our payment was conducted over the phone and we had to pay in full because there were only a "limited" number of package deals left (advertised as a "flash sale"). We initially met with Rick Lammert, and we set up a date for our engagement shoot in September 2014.
However, when we confirmed the photo shoot as it got closer to the date, we were told Rick was no longer with the company and Adam ended up shooting our engagement session. Up until that day, I was skeptical about Brooks Photography and was regretting paying in full up front as I normally don't do that. A few weeks after the engagement photo session, we received the link to all of our engagement photos, but received nothing else after that. That was also the last time we heard from Adam Brooks. In November, we saw the notices on his website and started coming across all of these bad reviews. All the numbers I had didn't work, and the only contact info I had was the email on his website. I expressed my concern via email, and surprisingly, I received a response (it wasn't Adam) and was reassured that my wedding was still good to go for 2015. We just recently found out about the bankruptcy. I wrote him again, but this time requesting a refund; I have yet to receive a response. I did a little digging, and this guy Adam Brooks filed for bankruptcy in 2009. I am going to pursue this until I get my money back.

102.review:
I wanted my hair to be lighter than it already was and I wanted hair extensions. Kassandra did a balayage blonde look and installed micro bead extensions in my hair. I absolutely love my hair!  She did a great job! 
Also, my husband is very picky and he also really liked how Kassandra left my hair looking. 
I also love that she comes to my house to do my hair which is very convenient for me because I have one year old twins and an 6 year old.

103.review:
Kassandra did my hair and makeup for a photo shoot at the end of last year and I'm not exaggerating, It was the best I've ever looked in my life! 
Yesterday I attended the third of her makeup classes and learned all about contouring. She provides great step by step make-up application as well as provides students with a great deal of product suggestions. She also recommends drug-store products which are very similar to the high end make-up. She even uses some of these products herself. She is more than willing to answer questions and give suggestions to every skin condition, face shape and type. She will give her honest opinion during the hands-on portion of the class. She will stop you and help you fix a technique by having you watch her in the mirror as she correctly demonstrates. Overall, she is an amazing make-up artist, hair stylist, and instructor. I am considering booking a one on one session with her to have her help me with my make-up application.

104.address: 4372 West Point Loma Blvd, Ste A
104.review:
I AM OUTRAGED 
We hired Brooks Photography based on a friends great review of him, and his great prices. Him and his associates seemed reputable and since we were getting married on a budget, it seemed to fit perfectly. Plus he was local to us and where we were getting married. 
DO NOT USE ADAM BROOKS AND HIS SERVICES!!!!!
My wedding was October 12th, 2014 and I haven't heard a peep from him about the status of my photos. I have phone numbers that don't work, dozens of e-mails that he has not responded to, even trying to contact him via Facebook, anything. I had precious memories, as everyone does on that amazing day, and now I have nothing to remember it by, because of some selfish scum-bag. My family and I are pursuing a lawsuit against him.

105.address: 4372 West Point Loma Blvd, Ste A
105.review:
NIGHTMARE!!!  
My wedding was 7 months ago and I still don't have everything I paid for in my contract.  I am especially upset because I paid for video of my wedding and received nothing!  Bad pictures, no communication, extremely unprofessional.  Complete waste of money.
As others have stated, this company in in San Diego, not Las Vegas.

Gave her 2 calls no answer looks like I'm going back to Oakland to get my hair done 4 thumbs down wish I could give this 0 stars

107.attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'HairSpecializesIn': "{'straightperms': False, 'coloring': False, 'extensions': True, 'africanamerican': True, 'curly': True, 'kids': True, 'perms': False, 'asian': True}"}
107.review:
My experience with Ms. Tiffany was bitter sweet. When I first got in contact with her she was prompt in answering my questions and confirming my appointment. I went to her house with a different type of hair she didn't like to work with, so I went back to the store and bought the hair she wanted. 

While she was doing my hair we had great conversation and watched a couple of movies. She was very professional. My hair was nice and neat. So why anniversary giving her two stars???

After a couple of days of my hair getting twisted (Senegalese), they started to frizz up. Two in the back came and so I messaged her to let her know about two weeks after getting my hair done it was starting to look messy. She told me that she would redo the ones that were messed up. Ok, cool! We scheduled a time for me to come, but an appointment I had that same day ran long and she had bronchitis.  We rescheduled for the next week. The night before we messaged to make sure I was still good for the appointment. She told me that we should of used Marley hair.  Ok, no problem. I went to her house and no answer.  I waited an hour and messaged her. No reply. An hour after that she responded and said her doctor appointment ran late and if I could come back. I told her the only days I was available were on Tuesday's and Sundays. She replied asking if I wanted my whole head redone. I told her only the parts that were messed up. She said I needed to make another appointment through the website. I asked her why if she was just redoing the ones that were unraveling. I also told her I wasn't paying her to redo my hair when I had them in for three weeks and they looked like I had them in for 3 months. I never received an answer.

I really didn't want to write a negative review but this is what happened to me.

108.address: 4372 West Point Loma Blvd, Ste A
108.review: I had my wedding on October 18th and since then I have not heard a word from anyone. I've e-mailed them several times and I just get an automated reply saying they have received my e-mail. I spent four thousand dollars and i'm really worried that i'm not going to get any photos or videos of my wedding.

109.address: 4372 West Point Loma Blvd, Ste A
109.review: I hired brooks photography to shoot my wedding on June 9th 2013. I thought they were great the day of my wedding...they were on time, professional and flexible. My nightmare started once it was time to receive their work. It has been nearly 5 months since my wedding and I have not received any prints, cds, photobooks or anything that was promised in the contract that was signed. I have called several times and left many messages simply for a status and I have not had any response from this business since August. I moved out of the state and I have not had the opportunity to send my family who was unable to attend a photo. Please save your money and go with a photographer that believes on delivering on what they promise or keeping their clients informed regarding delays. I am truly disgusted that someone would take money for a service and not find it important to give the client what they paid for. I am now forced to fly to San Diego to proceed with small claims court to recover my money back since apparently I will never receive any photographs or an update. The status (which woukd be sufficient). I have given the owner of this business every opportunity to make this right but he refuses to correspond. For those who had positive experiences I am glad you did and hope that my situation is not the norm.

110.attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'HairSpecializesIn': "{'straightperms': False, 'coloring': False, 'extensions': True, 'africanamerican': True, 'curly': True, 'kids': True, 'perms': False, 'asian': True}"}
110.review:
I've heard that Tiffany does great work but unfortunately never had the opportunity to find out. Tiffany is not reliable or what I would consider professional. I had an appointment with her for my 6 year old daughter and got stood up! 
She and I were texting back and forth the night before to confirm the time, what hair to buy, and how I should prep my daughters hair. HOWEVER, she never let me know WHERE her so called "shop" was. The address on her website is not correct. The day of the appointment I called and texted repeatedly for the address. Our appoint time came and went and Tiffany NEVER got back to me.  I had washed and blow dried my daughters hair and was getting on an airplane the next morning. Needless to say I was not happy and caught in a bind. I urge you to look elsewhere. I have some great recommendations if you care to message me.

UPDATE 4/20/16: To top things off I get an email from Tiffany as a result of my review as if I am the one in the wrong! I quote: "Thanks for you sad review!! So glad I didn't service your daughter. You are one of those miserable people who try to destroy businesses with you bad reviews!! Get a life and stay off my yelp page!!"

111.address: 4372 West Point Loma Blvd, Ste A
111.review:
This photographer is in San Diego, not Las Vegas. 

My wedding was 9/19/14. I have not heard from Adam and I have not recieved any photos or proofs. I know several others that this is happening to that have not left reviews yet. 
I would just really like my photos. I am heartbroken that there is a chance that I may not have wedding photos. 
ADAM: Please contact me ASAP!!!!!

112.attributes: {'BusinessParking': "{'garage': False, 'street': True, 'validated': False, 'lot': False, 'valet': False}", 'BikeParking': 'True', 'WheelchairAccessible': 'False', 'GoodForKids': 'True', 'RestaurantsPriceRange2': '2', 'ByAppointmentOnly': 'True', 'BusinessAcceptsCreditCards': 'True', 'HairSpecializesIn': "{'straightperms': False, 'coloring': False, 'extensions': True, 'africanamerican': True, 'curly': True, 'kids': True, 'perms': False, 'asian': True}"}
112.review: My experience With Ms.Tiffany was total the opposite from Ms.Kelli B. My braids are perfect and neat and my appointment was on time the Price was not expensive at all and also I think other people need to put themselves in a business owners position before they comment but I would recommend Ms.Tiffany's braiding lounge to anybody.

113.address: 4372 West Point Loma Blvd, Ste A
113.review: ATTENTION all Brides or anyone else who even considers hiring Adam Brooks from Brooks Photography. HE is an absolute fraud!!!!! Adam will take your money and not deliver what is promised in the contract. He will basically disappear on you and will be impossible to reach. He has been recently pulled from Wedding Wire and and will soon be pulled from other wedding websites. Legal action is taking place from numerous people. Adam Brooks from Brooks photography is also in the process of changing his business name. Maybe things have caught up to him and he needs to start over with a new scam. I will be sure to let EVERYONE know his new name once i get all the details. There is no way we will let him do this to anyone else. Especially brides on a very memorable day for them. Wheres the zero star option?

114.address: 4372 West Point Loma Blvd, Ste A
114.review: From my experience, Brooks Photo is not a very legitimate business.  We encountered their service while at a wedding.  The Photo Booth guy had an outdoor set up that was pitch dark.  He didn't bring lights or any background.  Instead, we just stood in the dark with a camera pointed at us.  He didn't have very many props either.  It was really sad and it consisted for probably less than 5 items. We didn't get any prints or information on where we could download copies of the photo.  They explained that their printer was "BROKEN." From reading the other yelp reviews, this appears to be a problem that occurs frequently.   You're a Photo Booth company, this is your bread and butter.  Shouldn't your equipment be checked beforehand? Instead of taking home individual photos, EVERYONE GOT NOTHING - ZELCH.  The guy also packed up and left early before the wedding ended, which was not part of their contract.

115.address: 4372 West Point Loma Blvd, Ste A
115.review: Anyone effected by this horrible scam please do not hesitate to contact me for a FREE photo session. Put your dress and tux back on and lets try to create some new memories for you, I know it wont re store what has been lost, but lets try to help this horrible situation!  Visit www.irishgrzanich.com to contact me and please know you should have never been treated like this!!!

116.address: 4372 West Point Loma Blvd, Ste A
116.review: We booked this crook and met him last June for our wedding next year and we paid $600 as downpayment for his future services. We want to schedule our so called "free" engagement as he personally mentioned to us this month but we can't contact him in any form (phone, text, e-mail). Let's bring this criminal to "Justice".

117.review: Just had our custom fireplace door installed today (see pictures) and couldn't be more happy with the workmanship and beauty. Danny is super nice, professional, talented and efficient! High quality workmanship and worth every penny! We highly recommend this company

118.review:
This guy's work is AMAZING!!!! Perfection down to the smallest detail. You can tell he takes pride in his work. Delivery and installation went as promised. 
We are so impressed we are going to have him do a outdoor fireplace for us. 

Rolls Royce service and workmanship  for a Honda price!!!

www.fireplacedoorguy.com
800-918-8757

119.review:
Friendly, decently priced, and my knives are sharp as hell. There's a small discount they give you if you track them down at a farmer's market, and their schedule is available on their website (www.finestedge.com).

No credit cards, unfortunately, but they take cash or check.

120.review: If you want a sharp edge, you HAVE to bring it to Michael Uno! This man understands, has MUCH experience and cares for your blade and will treat it with great respect. I had 2 Very bad experiences at 2 different places and they both left a Crap edge that would barely cut paper, and after bringing it here, my blade is sharp as hell! Now I can carry around my blade without feeling insecure about carrying a dull ass blade. I respect Michael Uno and will be telling everyone that needs an edge to bring it to him. Thanks so much for your work Michael!

121.review: Ian came out to clean my long over due, chimney. He did a great service, at a great price! Thankfully, he came on time, did a good job and did NOT try to sell me things I did not want. He also left my house without a trace of errant soot.

122.review: I enjoyed doing business with Mike. He was professional and attentive (as I'm sure one should be when handling knives). I loved the convenience of having him come over to my home to sharpen my knives as I have always thought that lugging a bunch of sharp objects to and from the grocery store or the farmer's market to get sharpened was a disaster just waiting to happen. (That's more of a commentary on my own potential ineptitude than other people's ^_^). Anyway, I highly recommend this service. Mike has assured me that my knives are now sharper than when I bought them. I have to make sure to be extra careful.

123.review: Overall a good experience.  The staff was professional, friendly and did a good job. There was 3 week turn around time for my doors.  After 6 weeks I called to inquire. The next week we finally had our doors put in.  That will be my only knock on my experience but not enough to take a star away. If you happen to need your order exactly when they estimated it, I would call them to make sure they are on schedule. I would recommend this company and do business with them again.

124.review: Danny and his guys are outstanding. I got everything fireplace doors and they came out beautiful.  They're service is first class.  I would recommend "the fireplace door guy to all". What an improvement to my home. Tell email Bob from Huntington Beach sent you.

125.review: We live in Oakland, so it was a leap of faith to have a custom fireplace door made hundreds of miles away in Temecula, but we are absolutely thrilled!  Our new door fit perfectly, was easy to install and, best of all, is a stunning work of art.  The waving grasses complement beautifully the dragon fly decorative corner tiles (to accommodate which Danny made perfect cuts in the frame--without complaint).  It has transformed our front room! On the administrative side:  phone calls and emails were initiated or promptly returned by nice people. A sample frame was sent so we could test the sizing against our uneven tiles.  We didn't pay until we approved the final product--and it cost less than we had dared to hope. Danny Vice is a remarkably skilled craftsman:  we should have done this years ago!

126.review: This is a mobile service that makes house calls and sets up at local farmers markets. I asked them to sharpen three very dull kitchen knives for me at the Los Altos Farmers Market. I was completely satisfied with their work. In addition to sharpening the knives, they did an amazing repair of a damaged 6" chefs knife (the blade tip was missing). The total bill was $22, which seems very reasonable. I'm going back next week with a few more knives.

127.review: I wasn't very skilled and gentle with my Japanese knife lately, so the blade went dull and got several small chips on the tip. Mike restored and sharpened the knife, which is now as sharp as new.

128.review: Super friendly folks. They sharpened up my knife at the Sunnyvale Farmer's Market. They were all smiles, and very quick service. Would recommend to anyone, hands down.

129.review:
Generous with his knowledge. Working at the farmer's market, he did 5 knives and a pair of scissors for me in about 15 minutes.
They are all better than new now!

130.review: This is my favorite knife sharpening business in the area! Not only do your knives get the best edge in town, but both owners believe in excellent customer service. You won't find another service like this - they will come to your home to sharpen your knives! What a wonderful bonus. If that's not your style, check out their schedule on the web for the farmers markets they do in the area. You can meet them for yourselves - wonderful couple. Just look for the folks with the biggest smiles and best knife sharpening tools in town. Then you'll know you've found the right place!

131.review: Mike from Finest-Edge came to my home to sharpen my knives and 2 of my friends knives.  Mike was on time to the appointment and very professional.  He did a fantastic job sharpening my knives and they were a joy to use!  He is passionate about what he does and it shows in his work.  I am a committed customer!!

132.review: Danny did some custom work for me, based on fireplace doors.  He made four custom dog kennel doors, for kennels that I had built under the stairs in my house. The work is beautiful, but Danny also made sure that they were built and installed exactly how I wanted them. It was tough to even find someone that was willing to take on this project. I feel like I hit the jackpot in finding Danny. The doors are gorgeous and feel like they will last forever, even with lots of daily use.  Thank you!

133.review:
I arranged a house call with the Finest-Edge to sharpen my knives
and those of several friends.  Among us we had 23 knives of various sizes and shapes included serrated, kitchen shears and garden tools.  Mike carefully labelled all of them to keep track of whose knives where who's and assessed the condition of each tool to determine what was needed.  He fixed broken tips and sharpened everything to perfection, carefully wrapping every tool back up.  The Finest-Edge provides expert, personalized, convenient and efficient service.  What more could you possibly ask for!

134.review: Mike arrived exactly on time and sharpened all of our knives (including some expensive Japanese ones) to perfection. Couldn't ask for more.

135.review: Spoke with Mike at the Sunnyvale Farmers Mkt one Saturday and decided to take advantage of his home service knife sharpening.  What a great convenience...and no additional charge with 10 or more items to sharpen.  The work was done out of Mike's "shop"...the back of his customized truck.  Great results, pretty speedy process, favorable pricing.  Treat yourself to some sharp knives...you'll notice the difference!  I highly recommend Mike and his company, Finest-Edge.

136.review: Very reasonable, efficient and effective life sharpening.

137.review: I don't usually write negative reviews except that this guy's treatment of me this afternoon was so in-your-face rude, that I felt I had to. He told me he stops accepting orders after 1:45 pm. I drove a fair distance back to his operation and arrived at 1:30, at which point he told me he's not accepting any more orders for the day.   It wouldn't have been so insulting, except that he accepted the order from the guy in right ahead of me, then decided to cut it off at me.  A total waste of my time and unprofessional to boot.  Sir, if you're participating in a Farmer's Market and specifically tell me you stop accepting orders at 1:45, and I arrive with my order at 1:30, you should honor your commitment.  I'd give you no stars if I could.

138.review:
I had a few knives that had really bad divots, Mike was able to get them fixed quickly (it was expensive Shun knives) and he gave me some advice on how to take care of them going forward.  He also does house calls I believe but you can find him at some of the local farmers markets. Thanks for the great service! 

*ask to see his hatchet, it's pretty cool*

139.review:
Had Mike come out for knife sharpening services as a birthday present for my partner. LOVED the fact that he does house calls - incredibly convenient and makes a great surprise gift :)

It is a 10 knife minimum for house calls, and I didn't realize that my apartment parking area didn't have adequate space size for his truck setup! Luckily he came before residents started coming home from work and he was able to setup. 

The price for the service is AMAZING, definitely competitive. Mike also even repaired a loose knife handle for us!!! 

I would highly recommend this business for all your knife sharpening needs!!!!

140.review: I love that they make house calls! We had about 12 pieces for them to sharpen and they came out and had them done in a little over an hour. Reasonable price and now I have sharp knives again!

141.review:
Dan (and his daughter/helper) were fabulous.  We have a 2-sided fireplace, and the doors fit perfectly and looked great.  Installation was quick and there was no mess.  We waited several weeks for the custom doors, but it was definitely worth it.  I would highly recommend 
Dan if you need a custom fireplace door, and especially if you want doors that will become the focal point of your home.

142.review:
I started my search for a replacement fire place door with a couple national manufacturers that claimed they were good with custom sizes.  Eventually I was referred to a local dealer of fireplace accessories.  They were pretty horrible, first denying they were a dealer of referring manufacturer, and then demanding up front payment to confirm my own measurements before working up an estimate.  

Danny was pretty much the opposite experience.  Showed up here promptly, lead us through the decision process, and started the order without even a deposit.  Very trusting, very professional.  

Three weeks later, Danny and Sean installed the doors.  Beautiful job!!  We are a very happy customer.  Changed the look of our living room.  Out with the 80's brass and glass, in with an awesome look.

143.review: Thanks Danny for your excellent work. Not only do our new doors look perfect but your professionalism and customer service was great. To anyone looking to get new doors we highly recommend him.

144.review: Ian came out to my place and installed one of their Oak Wood fireplace log kits and it was awesome. I can say that even though I don't know how much others would charge I felt very good about the product, knowledge, and services. Ian was courteous, professional, and listened to what we said. The end result was a transformed fireplace that exceeded my expectations. Give them a shot, it will be a positive experience.

145.review: I originally ordered my fireplace doors through a big company in the valley. They required full payment upfront. After 7 months my doors came in. Needless to say while I was waiting I called Fireplace Door Guy and set up an appt. Danny came over, took measurements and didn't ask for any payment. The turnaround was only 3 weeks for my beautiful handcrafted doors. I wish I would've found Danny before my horrible experience with "the other guys" who get the doors from NC. Great job!

146.review:
Hands down a 5 star rating. I arranged knife sharpening for my mom for Mother's Day, which Liana made a breeze even though I wouldn't be there.  They showed up on time and took great care of her. When Mike shows up with the truck, people will notice! Curious neighbors came from up and down the block, some bringing knives of their own to get sharpened. Definitely an extra bonus when Mom gets to brag. 

Of course, the biggest deal is the service. Mike took care of all of my folks' knives at a great price. The folks have a classic knife sharpening machine that they use biannually, but there it just isn't the same as a professional job. Mom also had old knives that hadn't been properly sharpened in about a decade, including my Grandmother's Tungston-Carbide steak knives, which are now in perfect shape. Mike knew right away what they were and took extra care. He was even able to repair an old knife that had a heavily bent edge so they can use it again. 

My mom is happy, I'm happy, so give these guys a call.

147.review:
I'm so grateful for Finest-Edge Precision's Mike and Liana because they beautifully restored a historic family heirloom that needed a lot of work and TLC.

I have a 1950s Forgecraft Hi-Carbon knife needed basic blade repair and sharpening, but also required a potential overhaul on a badly worn handle. This hazardous handle sported incredible amounts of organic build-up (aka "gunk"), and missed a couple necessary divots. I wasn't really sure what could be salvaged from this original handle, but sought out a solution because the knife had sentimental value to my family. 

After consulting numerous knife sharpening and repair services to no avail, I was pleasantly surprised to find that Mike at Finest-Edge Precision not only offered to see how he could help, but grasped the value and personal sentiment this knife presented to my family. Most repair services I called said that they couldn't work on handles, or asked upwards of $100 for their services to restore and repair the handle alone. 

I conveniently dropped it off with Mike and Liana in Menlo Park, and picked up the knife a couple weeks later at the Saratoga farmer's market (West Valley College). Mike had not only repaired and sharpened the knife blade, but also completely restored the original handle into excellent working condition! He cleaning out all the gunk, adding some new divots, and restored the original wood with some additional touch-up and finishing.

I'm so thankful that Finest-Edge Precision took on this project and helped restore this knife for a reasonable and fair price. I understand that most knife sharpening services focus only on blade repair and services, especially since it's more profitable and less time consuming than handle repair. That said, Mike, Liana and their company, Finest-Edge Precision, showed me that their focus is on holistic knife repair (handle and all), as well as providing the best possible service and support for all their customers.  

Finest-Edge Precision, you guys have earned my respect and my business for a long-time coming. Thanks again for your help, and God bless!

148.review: I've been meaning to take an assortment of knives and scissors to the local Mountain View hardware store, but never got around to it. Then I saw MIchael's mobile truck parked in front of my neighbor's house- problem solved! The knives and ancient scissors came back nice and sharp. The best part was that they didn't cost any more than the hardware store (possibly less), I got them back about 30 minutes later (not days later) and I didn't have to drive back and forth to the store. Will definitely use them again in the future.

149.review:
I purchased a door and it looks beautiful in my home. There is one concern I have and they stated that it will work itself out, and I'm giving the benefit of the doubt, but am concerned since it related to the door latch. I was told it has paint in it and it will work out on its own. I'm hopeful that is the case this year. 

Door Cost: Good
Quality Control: Fair
Customer Service: Good
Communication: Good
Installation: Excellent

150.review: These people aren't the regular "run of the mill" contractors that install anything and everything for money. They are experts at fireplace doors! Well worth every dime we paid, the craftsmanship and professional look and feel of my new fireplace doors are unmatched! Mr. Vice is courteous, professional and fast. From start to finish was about 2 weeks and it completely changed the look of our living room. Fantastic!! I highly recommend Danny and his company! Do not use 2nd best when THE BEST is right here!!

151.review: Danny truly is a craftsman, professional and a man of his word!!! We had Danny take care of our fireplace and it is so beautiful!!! You will not go wrong or be disappointed in any way!!! If you are looking for a replacement to your fire place door don't waste your time with Lowes, Home Depot or any online business!!! This man will take care of you from start to finish!!! Danny thank you for everything!! We are customers for life!!!

152.review:
I have several knives that I typically use, but I had ruined a Santoku style knife when I got lazy and used it to chop some chicken bone for broth and "dented" it in several locations and a chef's knife that I had abused for the past 25+ years and it had what appeared to be "waves" on the edge.  Eventually, my chef's knife couldn't even cut a tomato properly, so I thought it was time to see if it could be repaired and sharpened.  
     I occasionally go to the Saratoga Farmer's Market and remembered noticing Mike's truck in the corner, so I thought I'd email him and see if anything could be done.  Given my photos weren't the best, he did give me a ballpark cost but mentioned that he would have to see my knives to determine the full extent of damage I had done to my knives, which is an absolutely fair comment.
     The following weekend, I brought my damaged knives + another chef's knife, for sharpening only, to the Saratoga Farmer's Market where Mike and Liana told me my knives were completely repairable and it would only take about 20 minutes.  
     Not only was I very happy that they could repair my knives, they did it at a very reasonable price and in a very reasonable amount of time!  After my knives were repaired and sharpened, I couldn't tell where I had damaged the edges.  As soon as I got home, I gave it the paper test, where you hold a piece of paper and slice a sliver off... it passed with flying colors!
     I would absolutely bring my knives back to Mike and Liana in the future!

153.review:
I've got to agree with everyone else who has commented on using this artisan's services - OUTSTANDING WORK.

Initially, Jake came out and took measurements and provided a quotation.  Then Danny arranged to come back several times to confirm the measurements, do a dry-fit, then perform the final installation of these massive, designer doors.  He also placed fresh sand and lava rock in our gas fireplace as a final touch.

It's evident that Danny is proud of his work and it shows in his final product.  Plus, he's pleasant to be around.  He's a professional.

154.review:
Danny created a beautiful custom made door for our fireplace! Great price and quality! Shipping took about 3 weeks - totally worth waiting!
Thank you Danny!

155.review:
I came across this business while at the San Carlos Farmer's Market about 5 months ago.  He's there twice a month, in the BofA parking lot. 

He does a great job. The wait is never too long.  I drop off my knives and then I shop at the farmer's market and by the time I'm finished buying my produce, my knives are done!  His pricing is reasonable--it was less the $14 to sharpen a Chinese cleaver. My Japanese knife (5") plus a chef's knife (7") was under about  $10...that is a great price for 2 knives!! bring all my knives to him.  

I gave him old pizza cutter I found cleaning my mom's kitchen.  It was dull and hasn't been used in over 25 years.  He gladly sharpened it and, at no charge.  What a great guy!

159.review:
My first session for QHHT was with Jaclyn. I did not know what to expect and as like most people I have a preconceived notion of hypnosis. After Jaclyn discussed my questions and thoughts we began. She then put me in to a dream like state and the information began to flow. Let me also give some background on myself so that you can better understand me. I have been on opioid and other pain medication for over 8 years. I have other symptoms as well that go along with the chronic pain and have not been able to work full time during this span. Needless to say I have tried many doctors of both western and non western approach. My main focus of the session was getting to the root of my pain problem and getting off of the pain medication.

Jaclyn was able to make the session flow and ask the right questions to help me move forward. I was impressed by her ability to make me relax and keep moving when we hit any stumbling blocks. After the session I didn't feel any different however in the next few days things started to change. I did have healing crisis and I knew then my body was reacting to the  QHHT session. I feel it is important to mention that going over the session in a week or two is beneficial to getting the maximum results. New information can come to light that makes a difference after you have had time to absorb the experience.

Several months have gone by now since I write this and I am not sure if was the session or the with drawls from the opioid or both but things were a little rough for a while. I am now completely off of the opioid and my body is still healing. I have no doubt in the power of QHHT and even had my session muscle tested as to the effect. I don't know what the limitations are of a QHHT session however for me I know it got me the results I have been chasing for almost a decade.

201.review: I was eager to book with Rebecca, based on her website and the Yelp reviews.  I live two hours away and realized there would be a factor in me coming to her for a headshot, but her background still seemed to make it worth while.  When my daughter came down with mono, she was great with the cancellation. HOWEVER, here are the drawbacks: 1) The Living Social offer states she is willing to travel 20 miles.  She would not come 20 miles closer to me, which would have reduced my commute time. 2) She would only do headshots between 9 -10 in the morning and 5-6 in the evening, due to lighting.  She uses outdoors, not studio, so this, again, put me with an issue to get my make-up and hair done in the early morning so I could hit the road by 6:30 a.m.(not possible) or face afternoon commute.  Because I'm older, I look tired by 5 at night with a 2+ hour commute.  My problem? YES. But a 1 O'clock shoot time in a studio with soft focus works great.  To mitigate the problem, I asked if she had a hair and make up person in the area she works with. She said to come "natural".  I'm old...natural doesn't work with "old" and a head shot. :)  3)  The Living Social offer gives 2 prints.  After buying it, I found out that you cannot reproduce or use the prints in any digital format.  What good are headshots if you cannot reproduce them for distribution or use them in your social media?  This is obviously a come on to get you to "buy up".  4) Another issue of going through Living Social, you do not get the true value posted.  Rebecca's website says she meets with you to discuss the shoot and clothing options.  She flat out told me that she doesn't make enough from the vouchers to do anything other than take the pictures and print them.  No consultation.  This was a big reason why I bought her package, because I wanted expert advice.  5) Good luck finding a date and time that works.  She is slow to respond to emails and when I had dates available, she didn't. (My schedule is pretty wide open.) I finally had to get a refund.  The reason for 2 stars versus 1 is because she was good on the time I had to cancel for my daughter's illness.  I have worked in the L.A. area and have experienced much better professionalism and more honesty in what the end result would be with people who have studios to control the lighting.  Outdoor shooting is unpredictable.  So is Rebecca Vinacour Photography.
